content.question: Let f be the function given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mo>+</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F58@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. What is the coefficient of x3 in the Taylor series for f about x = 0 ?

topic.text: 10.14: (BC ONLY) Finding Taylor or Maclaurin Series for a Function
